title: 'Will shopping at Pretty Little Thing give me cancer?' Why it's time brands labelled ingredients in their clothes
text:
‘I am never shopping at Pretty Little Thing again.’ It was a message I received several times last week, not from women who had been put off after seeing one too many neon bodycon mini-dresses, but from those who had discovered a long-standing disclaimer in amongst the Terms and Conditions page of the fast fashion firm’s website, stating that some of its products may contain chemicals known to "cause cancer and birth defects."

Which certainly sounds shocking - but it’s more complicated than that. Firstly, I should reassure you that all products sold in the UK are regulated to EU standards, so the chemicals in question are not being used in quantities that would cause obvious serious harm (more...
